StoryTextNotTimeToLeaveEryn.text: There's something I still have to do.

StoryTextCantEnterBasementShower.text: This leads to the showers. No thanks.

StoryTextDay00CantExit.text: It's not time for your break yet.

StoryTextDay00NPC0Customers.text: We really need to make some sales.|Please help each customer.

StoryTextDay00NPC1Choice.text: Do you think this will fit my husband?|{ Uh..                { Yes, of course

StoryTextDay00NPC1Choice1Line0.text: These are one size fits all.

StoryTextDay00NPC1Choice1Line1.text: These say 38x34 that's not his size.|You're trying to trick me.

StoryTextDay00NPC2Choice.text: Are these all the shirts you have?|{ Yes                 { Define 'all'

StoryTextDay00NPC2Choice0Line1.text: We don't even have a back.

StoryTextDay00NPC2Choice0Line2.text: Well these aren't what I'm looking for.

StoryTextDay00NPC2Choice1Line0.text: Like are there more somewhere else?

StoryTextDay00NPC2Choice1Line1.text: Like not on these racks right here?

StoryTextDay00LisaWorriedLine0.text: Neither of them wanted anything?|Sales here are so terrible lately.|You can leave early since it's dead.

StoryTextDay00LisaWorriedLine1.text: My ride isn't coming for an hour.

StoryTextDay00LisaWorriedLine2.text: You should consider it a favor.|You don't want to be here after closing.|There's some weirdo wandering around.|I asked Todd to walk me to my car now.|Stop by the info desk if you have time.|It's a good place to learn about the mall.

StoryTextDay00InfoDeskLine3.text: As a welcome gift you can take something|from the lost & found bin.

StoryTextDay00InfoDeskLine4.text: Why would I want to do that?

StoryTextDay00InfoDeskLine5.text: At least take something to trade.

StoryTextDay00InfoDeskLine7.text: Mall employees trade all kinds of items.|Maybe you can get something better.

StoryTextDay00InfoDeskLine8.text: OK... I'll take that winter scarf.

StoryTextDay00InfoDeskLine10.text: (What am I going to do with this scarf?)

StoryTextDay00CavernChoice.text: Want to try a new game on free play?|{ Sure, why not       { Maybe later

StoryTextDay00CavernChoice0.text: Alright, it's this one over here.

StoryTextDay00CavernChoice1.text: Alright, stop by when you're free.

StoryTextDay00CavernLine3.text: Yeah, it's the future I guess.

StoryTextDay00CavernLine4.text: I don't think this is for me.

StoryTextDay00CavernLine5.text: What games do you like to play?

StoryTextDay00CavernLine6.text: We just have an old Atari at home.|Pac Man is fun even if it looks bad.

StoryTextDay00CavernLine7.text: I get that. Thanks for trying anyway.|Stop by anytime.

StoryTextDay00SVideoChoice.text: I don't suppose you want to help me out?|{ Help with what?     { Maybe later

StoryTextDay00SVideoChoice0.text: It's only my first day, but..|my manager ditched me with these boxes.

StoryTextDay00SVideoChoice1.text: I'd really appreciate it if you can.

StoryTextDay00SVideoLine1.text: It's also my first day.|But my manager sent me home early.

StoryTextDay00SVideoLine2.text: Jealous. Mine just disappeared.|I have to figure out how to close too.

StoryTextDay00SVideoLine4.text: I'm sure. It's just a lot deal with.|Also I'm new in town & don't know anyone.|Alright, where does this one go...

StoryTextDay00SVideoLine6.text: Thanks, I can get the rest from here.

StoryTextNight00TBooksLine1.text: Carl, how's this temp assignment going?

StoryTextNight00TBooksLine2.text: It's been alright. No complaints.|I've even made a few friends.

StoryTextNight00TBooksLine3.text: You already earned a key to every store|by helping them with various chores.

StoryTextNight00TBooksLine4.text: It's nice to get that out of the way.

StoryTextNight00TBooksLine5.text: Don't get too comfortable.|The permanent manager starts 12/31.

StoryTextNight00TBooksLine6.text: I still have one errand.|I need to deliver a special order.

StoryTextNight00TBooksLine7.text: I'll leave you to it then.

StoryTextNight00EEHallLine1.text: I told you not to loiter after closing!

StoryTextNight00EEHallLine4.text: I see him sneaking around every night.|He doesn't work here. He's up to something.

StoryTextNight00SVideoLine2.text: Yes, are you from the bookstore?

StoryTextNight00SVideoLine3.text: I am, I have the book you ordered.

StoryTextNight00SVideoLine4.text: Thanks! I'm new in town & it's boring.|I hope I find something fun to do.|It's not much, but have a free VHS tape.|Sorry if it's not your thing.

StoryTextNight00SouthHallLine3.text: You're losing it Carl.|Too many late nights isn't good for you.

StoryTextNight00SouthHallLine4.text: (Who was that anyway?)|(I don't remember him being a customer)

StoryTextNight00VBChoice.text: Are you heading out already?|{ Stay and talk       { Maybe later

StoryTextNight00VBChoice0.text: You always are done closing before me.

StoryTextNight00VBLine1.text: It's not a race, just how it goes.

StoryTextNight00VBLine2.text: You'd think after 2 years I'd be faster.

StoryTextNight00VBLine4.text: 2 years next month actually.|I was a salesman for Tandy before then.|We were beat by IBM & my region closed.|Luckily this store was opening then.

StoryTextNight00VBLine5.text: Have you always worked in tech sales?

StoryTextNight00VBLine6.text: I sold cars for a while.|I sold clothes for a while longer.|I'm happy to sell anything.

StoryTextNight00VBLine7.text: I've only worked in the bookstore.|I'm a bookworm though.

StoryTextNight00VBLine8.text: Sounds like a good fit.|Maybe you'll write one someday.

StoryTextNight00VBLine10.text: I think it's time to finish closing up.|Have a good night.

StoryTextNight00CPlanetChoice.text: Hey Carl, stopping by to chat?|{ That's right        { Jusy saying 'bye'

StoryTextNight00CPlanetChoice0.text: Great, maybe I can finally figure out|what kind of music you like.

StoryTextNight00CPlanetLine1.text: I told you, I mostly read.

StoryTextNight00CPlanetLine2.text: C'mon there has to be something.

StoryTextNight00CPlanetLine5.text: This is 'Metaphysical Graffiti'.|It came out earlier this year.|What do you think?

StoryTextNight00CPlanetLine6.text: It's kind of weird.|It's not for me.

StoryTextNight00CPlanetLine8.text: This one's a lot heavier.|It's called 'Facelift'.

StoryTextNight00CPlanetLine9.text: Sorry, this isn't for me either.

StoryTextNight00CPlanetLine10.text: I'm not going to quit trying.

StoryTextDay01DenimCountryNotDone.text: Let me know what you find out.

StoryTextDay01DenimCountryLine1.text: I have an assignment for you.

StoryTextDay01DenimCountryLine3.text: Go to the other stores & ask if|they've seen anything weird lately.

StoryTextDay01DenimCountryLine4.text: I thought this would be work related.

StoryTextDay01DenimCountryLine5.text: This is important.|I can't explain.|Just ask around please.

StoryTextDay01CPlanetLine1.text: You want to know about weird events?

StoryTextDay01CPlanetLine3.text: Nothing more than the usual weirdos.|Well, there's this one raggedy guy.|He comes by every day.|He never buys anything.|I don't know his deal.

StoryTextDay01WWAppliancesLine1.text: Anything weird?|There's one thing.|When I opened this morning it looked like someone tried to use the washers.|They made a huge mess.

StoryTextDay01WWAppliancesLine2.text: Maybe it was the night crew?

StoryTextDay01WWAppliancesLine3.text: I was stuck working a double shift.|It had to be after closing.

StoryTextDay01DenimCountry2Line3.text: Are you going to tell what this is about?

StoryTextDay01DenimCountry2Line4.text: OK, but don't think I'm crazy.|Look at this letter I received.|It was slipped through the gate.

StoryTextDay01DenimCountry2Line5.text: 'Lisa, you need to know something.|Your store will close in January.|There's nothing you can do to stop it.|You should get out before it happens.|-A friend.'

StoryTextDay01DenimCountry2Line6.text: It's really creeping me out.|Who sent this?|What if they're right?

StoryTextDay01CavernChoice.text: He's been here forever...|{ Do you need help?   { Not my problem

StoryTextDay01CavernChoice0.text: Yeah, that would be great.|I have to fix something quick.|Can you keep an eye on things for a bit?

StoryTextDay01CavernLine4.text: Just a temp, very temp actually.|Do you need change or something?

StoryTextDay01CavernLine7.text: I just watch other people play.

StoryTextDay01CavernLine8.text: You watch other people play games?

StoryTextDay01CavernLine9.text: It's still fun if they're good.|Maybe it will be on TV some day.

StoryTextDay01CavernLine10.text: Isn't it time to loiter down the hall?

StoryTextDay01CavernLine12.text: Poor kid is stuck here all day.|Like the mall is a free babysitter.|Thanks for helping out.

StoryTextDay01FCBCampingChoice.text: Have a minute to catch-up?|{ OK                  { Maybe later

StoryTextDay01FCBCampingChoice0.text: I don't know if you remember me.|I know your parents from back in the 70s.

StoryTextDay01FCBCampingLine1.text: I remember you vaguely.|You were over a couple times|when I was very little.

StoryTextDay01FCBCampingLine2.text: We drifted apart as you kids got older.|We were friends in high school.|They were a couple even back then.

StoryTextDay01FCBCampingLine3.text: That's what they told me too.

StoryTextDay01FCBCampingLine4.text: Our little group did everything together.|Although there wasn't much to do then.|Hanging out, camping in the summer.|We took a couple roadtrips too.|The usual teenage stuff.

StoryTextDay01FCBCampingLine5.text: They told me about some of them.

StoryTextDay01FCBCampingLine6.text: I won't keep you late today.|Stop by if you want to hear about one.

StoryTextNight01WEHallLine1.text: Hey, didn't I see you last week?|Don't worry, I won't call security.|Are you in some kind of trouble?

StoryTextNight01CavernLine1.text: Did some guy come through here?

StoryTextNight01CavernLine3.text: You sure? I swear he went this way.

StoryTextNight01CavernLine4.text: Even if he did, it's not my business.|Snooping around too much can cause drama.|I'm not getting involved again.

StoryTextNight01EEHallLine2.text: No, I'm just looking for someo...|Sorry, where do I know you from?

StoryTextNight01TLodgeLine1.text: Can you believe this place lasted so long?|Look at the junk they're selling.|They should have closed 12 years ago.

StoryTextNight01SouthHallLine2.text: I already have a ride.|Aren't I a little young for you?

StoryTextNight01SouthHallLine3.text: What? No it's not...|(geez)|I'm only saying hi, I don't have a car.|I'm on a temp assignment.|I'm staying at the discount hotel.|It's across the parking lot.

StoryTextNight01SouthHallLine4.text: Telling me about your hotel room..|Real subtle.

StoryTextNight01SouthHallLine5.text: No! Why do you keep going there?|Since I'm basically living here,|I like to meet other employees.|That's all, I swear.

StoryTextNight01SouthHallLine6.text: Still sounds shady but, OK, I'm Eryn.|I work at Denim Country.|I don't work that much though.|Lisa sends me on crazy snipe hunts.

StoryTextNight01SouthHallLine7.text: She did the same thing over summer.|Drove the last help to quit.

StoryTextNight01SouthHallLine8.text: I'm only here until January so whatever.

StoryTextNight01SouthHallLine9.text: Hey. you never know though.|That's what I thought 8 years ago.

StoryTextNight01SouthHallLine10.text: You can help her after I'm gone then.

StoryTextNight01WWAppliancesChoice.text: Know how to fix a refrigerator?|{ I can try           { I don't think so

StoryTextNight01WWAppliancesChoice0.text: Great, this one is acting funny.

StoryTextNight01WWAppliancesChoice1.text: I'd appreciate it if you could try.

StoryTextNight01WWAppliancesLine1.text: Are they supposed to be on?

StoryTextNight01WWAppliancesLine2.text: They aren't supposed to be cold.|But the light should still come on.|This one isn't though.|I already tried changing the bulb.

StoryTextNight01WWAppliancesLine3.text: I bet it's the door switch.|Don't ask how I know that.|Yeah, it's jammed. Let me try...|...and I think it's good for now.

StoryTextNight01WWAppliancesLine4.text: Good enough for me.|Thanks for the help.

StoryTextNight01VBChoice.text: Thanksgiving weekend...|{ Stay and talk       { Maybe later

StoryTextNight01VBChoice0.text: Hey Carl. I was just thinking for a bit.

StoryTextNight01VBChoice1.text: Sorry, lost in thought.|Stop by if you get a chance.

StoryTextNight01VBLine2.text: More like lack thereof.|My family didn't really celebrate.|Neither set of grandparents were happy about my parents' marriage.|We usually got Chinese food to go.

StoryTextNight01VBLine4.text: I guess it wasn't too bad.|Could have been nothing.|I never mind working this weekend though.|Let people with big gatherings take off.

StoryTextNight01VBLine5.text: I feel the same way as you.|My family is small & scattered.|This weekend feels chaotic enough.

StoryTextNight01VBLine6.text: Never thought about it like that.|This is the quiet part then.|After dinner & everyone is sleepy.

StoryTextNight01VBLine7.text: Yeah, that's what it's like now.|I'll let you get back to closing.

StoryTextDay02VBLine1.text: Why are you asking me about this?

StoryTextDay02VBLine2.text: I don't know.|She told me to talk to people who worked here a long time.

StoryTextDay02VBLine3.text: Well I'm old, but this store isn't.|We only opened 2 years ago.|The mall opened in 1975.|ThoreauBooks & Transistor Lodge are the only original stores left.|Maybe they know some mall legends.

StoryTextDay02VBLine5.text: Like urban legends, but in a mall.|Both have weird bits of history.

StoryTextDay02TLodgeLine1.text: Mall legends? I've heard of them.|There's one I think is true.

StoryTextDay02TLodgeLine3.text: The mall was built in 1975.|It had a state of the art computer system.|For climate control and muzac.|Seemed like overkill for the time.|At least once a month the mall manager comes here looking for an old part.|They must still use an old computer.|Maybe even the original one.

StoryTextDay02TBooksLine1.text: I'm sorry about the other night.|I came across creepy.

StoryTextDay02TBooksLine2.text: It's OK. Let's move on.|Do you know any mall legends?|Maybe going back to 1975.

StoryTextDay02TBooksLine3.text: I'm older than the average employee...|I've only been here 6 months though.|I'm the assistant manager at a different location in the city.|I'm filling in until they hire someone.|This mall is too weird for me.|The customers I mean.

StoryTextDay02TBooksLine4.text: They aren't very smart.|Not sure about weird.

StoryTextDay02TBooksLine5.text: Maybe it's only here then...|I get a lot who are dressed odd.|Or that ask for books I never heard of.|Maybe they're tourists.

StoryTextDay02DenimCountryNotDone.text: Sounds like you didn't find much yet.

StoryTextDay02DenimCountryLine1.text: So that's all you found?|Old computers & weirdos?

StoryTextDay02DenimCountryLine2.text: Not sure what else you were expecting.

StoryTextDay02DenimCountryLine3.text: I'm sorry. I thought you might get lucky.|The letter is from someone who knows|something secret about the mall.|How would they know a store will close?

StoryTextDay02DenimCountryLine5.text: That sounds awful.|Who would do that?|Oh, by the way...|Jen from Nut Shack came by looking for you.|I didn't know you were friends.

StoryTextDay02DenimCountryLine6.text: Neither did I, but OK.|(I should see what she wants.)

StoryTextDay02NShackLine1.text: I think it's same as last year.

StoryTextDay02NShackLine2.text: Maybe it is, maybe not.|I talked to him but he wouldn't open up.

StoryTextDay02NShackLine3.text: I don't want to get involved.

StoryTextDay02NShackLine4.text: If he talks to me that's fine.|But I'm not looking for drama again.

StoryTextDay02NShackLine7.text: It's fine, you're not interrupting.|Employees stop here for snacks often,|so I hear a lot of rumors.|You're asking around about something?

StoryTextDay02NShackLine8.text: I'm not. I don't care.|Lisa wants to know who sent this letter.|I think it's a prank.

StoryTextDay02NShackLine9.text: That's one explanation.|Who could really know the future anyway?|Still, it could be someone who cares.|Denim on denim won't last forever.|Did I see you waiting in the hall late?

StoryTextDay02NShackLine10.text: Yeah, I don't have a car yet.

StoryTextDay02NShackLine11.text: You can wait here instead.|I don't know if it's safe late.|There are some odd types around lately.

StoryTextNight02TBooksLine1.text: (I'm done early tonight)|(I should check-in with some friends)|(Who haven't I seen in a while?)

StoryTextDay02SVideoChoice.text: Can you watch the store for a minute?|{ How hard can it be? { Maybe later

StoryTextDay02SVideoChoice0.text: Thanks, I'm just grabbing a snack.

StoryTextDay02SVideoChoice1.text: If you can help that would be great.

StoryTextDay02SVideoLine1.text: Did this store used to be something else?

StoryTextDay02SVideoLine2.text: Everything used to be something else.

StoryTextDay02SVideoLine4.text: Hey. Is this the video store?

StoryTextDay02SVideoLine7.text: Do you have a military discount?

StoryTextDay02SVideoLine12.text: That's a huge relief to hear.|I thought you'd get some dumb customers.|Thanks again.

StoryTextDay02FCBCampingChoice.text: Got time for a quick memory?|{ OK                  { Maybe later

StoryTextDay02FCBCampingChoice0.text: I'll never forget the summer|after our senior year.|We drove up north to go camping.|Your mom was so excited.|She packed a ton of grilling supplies.|It rained all weekend though.|We ate at a dumpy small pizza place.|Luckily she packed extra blankets.|It was so cold at night.

StoryTextDay02FCBCampingLine2.text: It was still a good time though.|When you're with friends even a bad situation can turn out alright.

StoryTextNight02FCBCampingLine1.text: What brings you by so late?

StoryTextNight02FCBCampingLine2.text: Nothing specific this time.|Just seeing how things are going.

StoryTextNight02FCBCampingLine3.text: That's good. I thought you might be sneaking into a tent for the night.

StoryTextNight02FCBCampingLine4.text: No, no... Wait, has that happened?

StoryTextNight02FCBCampingLine5.text: Not recently but last year.|An ex employee slept here at night.|He got away with it for over a month.|I wait here until it's time to lock up.|In case someone else gets that idea.

StoryTextNight02FCBCampingLine6.text: Someone living in the mall...|Needing a place to sleep every night.|It's sad to think about.|(I wonder if it's happening again.)

StoryTextNight02NShackLine1.text: Is this one of the after hours people|you warned me about?

StoryTextNight02NShackLine2.text: Yeah, watch out for this guy.

StoryTextNight02NShackLine4.text: You know I'm kidding.|Carl is harmless.|He even helped me once,|by dealing with some expired products.

StoryTextNight02NShackLine5.text: I don't think my back will recover.|Are you on break?

StoryTextNight02NShackLine6.text: I'm loitering until my ride comes.

StoryTextNight02NShackLine7.text: This is a popular spot for that.|I'll probably see you here again then.

StoryTextNight02WWHallLine1.text: Finally taking off for the night?

StoryTextNight02WWHallLine2.text: Yeah. And why are you here after close?

StoryTextNight02WWHallLine3.text: Same reason as you of course.|Where else do I have to be?

StoryTextNight02CNowLine1.text: Just look at this place.|Remember when it was...|What was it called again?

StoryTextNight02CNowLine3.text: It's not like I'm here to rob you.

StoryTextNight02VisionLine2.text: I watch the news|until I fall asleep.

StoryTextNight02VisionLine3.text: I hope there's not a war in Iraq.|There's too much to worry about.|Why does that one guy know me?|What is the other hiding from?|Now an update on the Iraq situation...|It looks inevitable.|I hope it's all OK.

StoryTextNight02VisionLine4.text: OK Carl, this is Victor.|He's from the company I mentioned.

StoryTextNight02VisionLine5.text: We'll being seeing a lot of each other|for the next 2-3 years.

StoryTextNight02VisionLine7.text: I know you're not happy.|No one wanted it to go like this.

StoryTextNight02VisionLine9.text: If you're both done commiserating|we have a lot to start on.

StoryTextNight02VisionLine10.text: Get a load of this dump.

StoryTextNight02VisionLine12.text: This is the worst one yet.

StoryTextNight02VisionLine13.text: You don't need to remember me.|We only talked once.

StoryTextNight02VBChoice.text: Hey Carl, Stopping by to talk?|{ That's right        { Maybe later

StoryTextNight02VBChoice0.text: I'm waiting for the register to finish.|It takes at least 30 minutes.

StoryTextNight02VBLine2.text: The computer it runs on is ancient.|And that's coming from me.|I haven't sold Tandys for 2 years|but even those were newer.|This is a modified C128.|The real problem is the modem.|300 baud, very slow.

StoryTextNight02VBLine3.text: I don't know what any of that means.|I'll take your word for it.

StoryTextNight02VBLine4.text: I know it sounds complicated.|Second language to me though.|Thanks for listening.

StoryTextNight02CPlanetChoice.text: I think I figured it out...|{ Figured what out?   { Maybe later

StoryTextNight02CPlanetChoice0.text: How to find out what music you like.

StoryTextNight02CPlanetLine2.text: That's right. I have a quiz this time.|Question #1: what is your favorite color?

StoryTextNight02CPlanetLine4.text: Seriously?|OK, next..|Which dog breed would you be?

StoryTextNight02CPlanetLine6.text: At a party are you popular?

StoryTextNight02CPlanetLine7.text: I don't remember going to one.

StoryTextNight02CPlanetLine8.text: Where would you like to live?

StoryTextNight02CPlanetLine10.text: Alright, this says 'City Pop'.|That can't be right.

StoryTextNight02CPlanetLine11.text: I've never heard of it.|Thanks for trying I guess.

StoryTextDay03DenimCountryLine1.text: Alright, I tried all the stores.|No one admitted sending the letter.

StoryTextDay03DenimCountryLine2.text: I didn't go to the so-called food court.|I can't even set foot in PogoDawg.|It's too gross in there.|Can you go for me?

StoryTextDay03DenimCountryInprogress.text: Let me know what the guy at PogoDawg says.|(If he says anything coherent)

StoryTextDay03DenimCountry2Line2.text: I assume he wasn't any help then.|Sorry if I wasted your time.|I don't know what to make of this.|Either someone is lying to me,|or that letter's from someone I missed.

StoryTextDay03PogoDawgLine1.text: Hi. Did you send this letter?

StoryTextDay03PogoDawgLine2.text: Huh?|Woah.|Uh, can I take your, um, order?

StoryTextDay03PogoDawgLine4.text: Uh. For here or, ah, what is it called?|For delivery?

StoryTextDay03PogoDawgLine6.text: Are you the... |where was I?|Right, the new delivery girl?

StoryTextDay03PogoDawgLine8.text: OK. There are 1, no, wait, um..|No, 2 orders. Is that.. yeah 2.

StoryTextDay03PogoDawgLine9.text: These bags here? They don't have names.|Just these crude pictures.|4 squares on one, a dress on the other.

StoryTextDay03PogoDawgLine10.text: Yeah, that's, uh...|...|Where they, you know, go.

StoryTextDay03PogoDawgLine11.text: If I deliver both of these these,|will you answer my question?

StoryTextDay03PogoDawgInprogress.text: Uh, we'll talk when you are, um, done.

StoryTextDay03CheckersLine1.text: I think this is for you.

StoryTextDay03CheckersLine2.text: I thought you worked with Lisa?

StoryTextDay03CheckersLine3.text: This is a vital part of the job.

StoryTextDay03CheckersLine4.text: I don't get it, but OK.|Hey, did she mention my new years party?|She hasn't said if she's coming.

StoryTextDay03CNowLine1.text: It is, thanks. I'm stuck here alone.|Care to join me for lunch?

StoryTextDay03SouthHallLine1.text: I don't suppose you have an extra order?

StoryTextDay03PogoDawg2Line1.text: I determined you didn't write this|because I don't think you can read.

StoryTextDay03PogoDawg2Line2.text: That's, uh, mean. No, I mean, um, right.

StoryTextDay03CavernChoice.text: Want to test something?|{ Sure                { Maybe later

StoryTextDay03CavernChoice0.text: All these games have difficulty settings.|You have to find the right balance.|See if this one is too hard.

StoryTextDay03CavernLine1.text: Kind of, maybe if I practiced.

StoryTextDay03CavernLine2.text: You shouldn't have to though.|I'll turn it back down.

StoryTextDay03CavernLine5.text: That's bad too, in a different way.|One person could play it forever.|That's fine for a home game.|I have to break even here.|Anyway, that's all for today.|Thanks for helping.

StoryTextDay03SVideoChoice.text: Are you any good at math?|{ I'm OK              { Never heard of it

StoryTextDay03SVideoLine1.text: I'm stuck on this graph.|How can I prove if the graph is a tree?

StoryTextDay03SVideoLine2.text: You can disprove it quickly by proving if|it contains a circuit.

StoryTextDay03SVideoLine5.text: Thanks, I think I can get the rest of these.

StoryTextNight03TBooksLine1.text: (Maybe I am losing it)|(I keep seeing that guy in a suit)|(He knows me but I don't know him)|(Is he even real? He must be.)|(I should revisit where he went)

StoryTextNight03TLodgeLine1.text: Has a guy in a suit been by here?|After closing I mean.

StoryTextNight03TLodgeLine2.text: Someone like that came in.|It was a while ago.

StoryTextNight03TLodgeLine4.text: He made fun of our store and left.|Said he didn't know how we're still open.|What a jerk.

StoryTextNight03TLodgeAltLine1.text: Last month some guy in a suit was here.|It was after closing. Do you remember?

StoryTextNight03TLodgeAltLine2.text: I remember. I forgot to lock the gate.|He was all rude about my store.

StoryTextNight03TLodgeAltLine4.text: I remember he talked to you.|I thought you were friends.

StoryTextNight03TLodgeAltLine5.text: Definitely not friends.|I can't get over something he said.|That he was surprised you were still open.

StoryTextNight03TLodgeAltLine6.text: I know, business is great this year.|I don't know what he meant by that.|Maybe he's just a jerk.

StoryTextNight03CNowLine1.text: Was a guy in a suit here after close?|About two weeks ago.

StoryTextNight03CNowLine2.text: Yeah, he just barged right in.|I thought he was a robber.|I was so scared, really badly.|He just made fun of the store & left.

StoryTextNight03CNowLine3.text: He didn't say why he was there?

StoryTextNight03CNowLine4.text: No, he just made rude comments and left.|Who does that?

StoryTextNight03CNowAltLine1.text: About two weeks ago, do you remember?|A guy in a suit was here after close?

StoryTextNight03CNowAltLine2.text: I can't forget it. It was awful.|I didn't thank you for showing up.|I thought he was there to rob us.|You must have scared him away.

StoryTextNight03CNowAltLine3.text: I'm not so sure about that.|He talked like he knew me.

StoryTextNight03CNowAltLine4.text: I thought he was a customer of yours.|You really never saw him before?

StoryTextNight03CNowAltLine5.text: No. I mean, kind of. I think.|I've seen him before.|But I don't know him.

StoryTextNight03CantEnterNShack.text: I have something to finish first.

StoryTextNight03NShackLine1.text: You're late. Just like Eryn's ride.

StoryTextNight03NShackLine2.text: Sorry, I got side tracked.|This is strange but I have to ask..|Did a rude guy in a suit stop by here?

StoryTextNight03NShackLine3.text: I've had rude guys,|and guys in suits.|Not both at the same time.

StoryTextNight03NShackLine4.text: Guys in suits aren't our demographic.

StoryTextNight03NShackLine5.text: Why do you care about this guy?

StoryTextNight03NShackLine6.text: I keep running into him.|He knows my name & how much I work,|he acts like we're acquainted.

StoryTextNight03NShackLine7.text: He's probably just a customer.|You talk to a dozen people a day.|You can't remember all their names.

StoryTextNight03NShackLine8.text: That's probably it. Thanks.|I'm working open to close every day.|Maybe I'm exhausted.

StoryTextNight03NShackLine9.text: Yeah, go to that hotel room.

StoryTextNight03NShackLine10.text: You're never going to let me forget that.

StoryTextNight03WWCheckoutChoice.text: Do you know how to fix a register?|{ I can try           { I don't think so

StoryTextNight03WWCheckoutChoice0.text: This keeps giving us an error message.

StoryTextNight03WWCheckoutChoice1.text: I thought it was worth a try.

StoryTextNight03WWCheckoutLine1.text: OK, hmm.. that's a weird one.|Did you try turning it off & on?

StoryTextNight03WWCheckoutLine2.text: It would lose the totals for the day.

StoryTextNight03WWCheckoutLine4.text: I thought I heard a fuss in here.

StoryTextNight03WWCheckoutLine5.text: Mind if I take a peek?

StoryTextNight03WWCheckoutLine7.text: OK, escape, control F12, Y. There you go.

StoryTextNight03CPlanetChoice.text: Care to help for a minute?|{ Alright             { Maybe later

StoryTextNight03CPlanetChoice0.text: I have to markdown a bunch of singles.|One hit wonders of the past few years.

StoryTextNight03CPlanetLine2.text: You know, bands that had one hit song.|Then they just disappeared.

StoryTextNight03CPlanetLine3.text: I didn't know that had a name.

StoryTextNight03CPlanetLine5.text: I thought they were still making music.

StoryTextNight03CPlanetLine8.text: Then there's|Will to Power.|They just covered two songs.|It shouldn't even count.

StoryTextNight03CPlanetLine10.text: It's one thing to write a hit song.|It's another to redo a song that was already a major hit years ago.|I can respect someone that wrote a song.|Like this one,|'Just a Friend'.|Not my thing, but at least he wrote it.

StoryTextNight03CPlanetLine12.text: Alright, that's all of them.|Thanks for the help.

StoryTextDay04CavernLine3.text: I thought someone came in before me.

StoryTextDay04CavernLine4.text: Nope. It's just me here.|Are you coming by after your shift?

StoryTextDay04CavernLine5.text: Probably going to grab a snack today.

StoryTextDay04NShackLine5.text: Yes, since last holiday season.|And his sister even longer.

StoryTextDay04NShackLine6.text: Is there a reason he would lie to me?|I think he just lied about someone|going into the arcade.

StoryTextDay04NShackLine7.text: Maybe he's covering for them.|He says he doesn't like helping people.|But that's not true at all.|Maybe this is someone in trouble.

StoryTextDay04NShackLine8.text: So he told you about this person?

StoryTextDay04NShackLine9.text: No, but I have an idea what's going on.|He'll tell me when he's ready.

StoryTextDay04SVideoChoice.text: I really need some help here.|{ Alright             { Not now

StoryTextDay04SVideoChoice0.text: Thanks. I can't get this guy to leave.|I think he's trying to hit on me.

StoryTextDay04SVideoLine3.text: No, I was just, looking at...

StoryTextDay04SVideoLine5.text: This movie right here, do you know,|or maybe the other one there|does she know if it's any good?

StoryTextDay04SVideoLine6.text: We're not allowed to share opinions.

StoryTextDay04SVideoLine7.text: OK, so then is it, um.

StoryTextDay04SVideoLine8.text: Look are you going to buy something or not?

StoryTextDay04SVideoLine10.text: Wow, that was great.|How did you do that?

StoryTextDay04SVideoLine11.text: I have three older brothers.|Their friends are all idiots like that.

StoryTextDay04FCBCampingChoice.text: (That was so long ago...)|{ Daydreaming?        { (I'll leave him be)

StoryTextDay04FCBCampingChoice0.text: Sorry, didn't see you there.|I was just think about a roadtrip|I went on with your father.|Before your oldest brother was born.

StoryTextDay04FCBCampingLine2.text: Anywhere and everywhere.|We bought a pair of cheap motorcycles.|We went across the whole country & back.|All we had were backpacks & tents.|We camped wherever we stopped.|Didn't even bring a map.

StoryTextDay04FCBCampingLine3.text: I think he'd do that now if he could.

StoryTextDay04FCBCampingLine4.text: We're both long past doing that.|If you ever get a chance like that|do it while you are young.

StoryTextNight04TBooksLine1.text: Things have been going well since you took over this location.|Sales are up, and so are repeat customers.

StoryTextNight04TBooksLine2.text: I can't take all the credit.|The store was in good shape already.

StoryTextNight04TBooksLine3.text: Whatever you're doing is working.|Any chance you'd like to stay here?

StoryTextNight04TBooksLine4.text: I haven't thought about it.|I made some friends here.|I also miss my old store.|That mall is much busier.|I don't know. It's a tough call.|But I'll think about it.

StoryTextNight04TBooksLine5.text: Let's talk again after the holidays.

StoryTextNight04NShackLine3.text: I told you I don't care.|I'm only a little curious.

StoryTextNight04NShackLine5.text: A week ago I saw this disheveled guy,|he went into the cavern & disappeared.|D.B. acted like he never saw him.

StoryTextNight04NShackLine6.text: There is a backroom there.|I think they keep old games in it.|Maybe he was a repair guy.|Probably just let himself in.|D.B. might not have noticed.

StoryTextNight04NShackLine8.text: This is easy.|I'll go ask.|I'm sure it's nothing interesting.

StoryTextNight04CantUseStairs.text: (I should ask where this goes first)|(I'll ask D.B. when he's back)

StoryTextNight04CavernLine1.text: (D.B. must have gone home already)|(I'll just look around a little)

StoryTextNight04SouthHallLine2.text: Who else would be leaving now?

StoryTextNight04SouthHallLine3.text: You're freaking people out here.|With all the things you're saying.

StoryTextNight04SouthHallLine4.text: Have I said anything untrue?|They'll get over it soon enough.|This is just a temp job for them.

StoryTextNight04SouthHallLine5.text: What do you mean by that?|Do you know something?|Do you know about the mall's future?

StoryTextNight04SouthHallLine6.text: If I knew the future I'd buy stock.|Go get some sleep Carl.|You sound sleep deprived again.

StoryTextNight04WWTVChoice.text: (What are they doing?)|{ Say hello           { Leave them alone

StoryTextNight04WWTVLine1.text: It's alright. Come join us.|We're trying to get some reception.|Old holiday cartoons are on tonight.|What's your favorite?

StoryTextNight04WWTVLine2.text: Favorite cartoon?|I don't know.|I'm more of a book person.

StoryTextNight04WWTVLine4.text: That's good, but I prefer Peanuts.

StoryTextNight04WWTVLine5.text: I don't think I've seen either of those.

StoryTextNight04WWTVLine6.text: You're really missing out.|Are you just going to watch the news again?|Is that how you want to spend the night?

StoryTextNight04VBChoice.text: You look troubled tonight Carl.|{ Just a little       { I'm good

StoryTextNight04VBChoice0.text: My DM asked if I want to stay?

StoryTextNight04VBChoice1.text: If you ever need to talk, I'm here.

StoryTextNight04VBLine4.text: That's a really tough question.|There are pros & cons.|Maybe I should write them down.

StoryTextNight04VBLine5.text: That's a good way to start.|Make two lists & rank them.|The biggest pro could beat the biggest con|or it could be the other way around.

StoryTextNight04VBLine6.text: I'll do that at the hotel.|I can do that while the news is on.|Thanks for the talk.

StoryTextDay05DenimCountryLine1.text: I see you haven't changed.|Fretting about whether the store.|You've have an ulcer before 30.

StoryTextDay05DenimCountryLine2.text: I don't know what I'll do if we close.

StoryTextDay05DenimCountryLine3.text: You'll find some other mall job.|Or better yet go back to school.|Or figure something else out.|How about we make your goal today.|Would that help your mood?

StoryTextDay05DenimCountryLine5.text: Hey, new girl. Let's make it interesting.|I'm free for an hour or two.|Let's see who can refer more customers to the store before closing.|You should be able to get 2 easily.

StoryTextDay05FCBFirearmsChoice.text: Which of these makes the best gift?|{ Which weapon?       { Who is it for?

StoryTextDay05FCBFirearmsRespond0Line01.text: Oh, I thought this was the toy store.

StoryTextDay05FCBFirearmsRespond0Line02.text: No. And surprisingly there isn't|a toy store in this mall.|Maybe the designer forgot...|Maybe the mall was too big & it got cut.|Whatever the case, no toy store.

StoryTextDay05FCBFirearmsRespond0Line04.text: Whoever designed this mall placed an odd amount of importance on denim.|Like it's the fabric of their life.|I'd suggest Denim Country,|denim never goes out of style.

StoryTextDay05FCBFirearmsRespond0Line05.text: Thanks, I'll give it a try.

StoryTextDay05FCBFirearmsRespond1Line01.text: It's for my teenage nephew.|He has anger management issues.|I thought it might help.

StoryTextDay05FCBFirearmsRespond1Line02.text: Even I think that's a bad idea.

StoryTextDay05FCBFirearmsRespond1Line03.text: How about a fauz fur denim trucker jacket?|It will convey a strong message.|One that says 'leave me alone'.|You can get it at Denim Country.

StoryTextDay05FCBFirearmsRespond1Line04.text: I hate to lose a sale, but nice save.

StoryTextDay05WWAudioChoice.text: Will these fit on my father's yacht?|{ Weight limit?       { On this lake?

StoryTextDay05WWAudioRespond0Line01.text: There has to be a maximum weight right?

StoryTextDay05WWAudioRespond0Line02.text: Huh, yeah. It's.. I don't know.

StoryTextDay05WWAudioRespond0Line03.text: And does it have AC plugs?

StoryTextDay05WWAudioRespond0Line05.text: And aren't marine radios a custom part not typically found in a mall?

StoryTextDay05WWAudioRespond0Line07.text: You just wanted to talk about the yacht.

StoryTextDay05WWAudioRespond0Line08.text: It's a really nice yacht though.

StoryTextDay05WWAudioRespond1Line01.text: The lake is tiny, more like a pond.|The mall name is a misnomer.

StoryTextDay05WWAudioRespond1Line02.text: I didn't say we sailed it.|It's just for parties.

StoryTextDay05WWAudioRespond1Line03.text: Then why does it matter if it fits?

StoryTextDay05WWAudioRespond1Line04.text: That's a very good point.|I should find one the size of a house.

StoryTextDay05DenimCountry2Line1.text: This is all so totally obvious.|The mall manager sent that letter.|Who else would know that in advance?|Just confront him already.

StoryTextDay05DenimCountry2Line2.text: Isn't his office in the basement?|I heard a rumor it's all creepy.|I don't know if I can...

StoryTextDay05DenimCountry2Line3.text: I'll just go myself already.|I'm not scared of that loser.

StoryTextDay05DenimCountry2Line4.text: Looks like the score is 1:1 this time.|Rematch next year, if you're around.

StoryTextDay05CavernChoice.text: Which one would she like?|{ Want some help?     { Not now

StoryTextDay05CavernChoice0.text: Yeah. My sister doesn't like any of the new games out right now.|There has to be one for her.

StoryTextDay05CavernChoice1.text: If you're free later, stop by.

StoryTextDay05CavernLine2.text: The fighter games, those were a pass.|I already know golf would be out.

StoryTextDay05CavernLine4.text: I see you're both hard at work.

StoryTextDay05CavernLine5.text: Hey, try this game over here.

StoryTextDay05CavernLine7.text: It's kind of blocky.|It's alright I guess.|Am I supposed to drive through that?

StoryTextDay05CavernLine9.text: Great, now I'm nauseous.|It's not the worst thing I played.

StoryTextDay05FCBCampingChoice.text: Stopping by for a quick talk?|{ Yeah                { Maybe later

StoryTextDay05FCBCampingChoice0.text: I can't believe how old you are already.|It seems like you all were born yesterday.|I suppose that's when we fell out of touch.|It's not like we had a falling out.|They were raising a family.|I wanted to keep rambling.

StoryTextDay05FCBCampingLine1.text: I only saw you a couple times.|Summer cookouts mostly.

StoryTextDay05FCBCampingLine2.text: Who remembers their parents friends?|I miss the old times with them.|But I wouldn't change a thing.

StoryTextNight05TBooksLine1.text: I like what you've done with the place.

StoryTextNight05TBooksLine2.text: Thanks. I didn't change much though.

StoryTextNight05TBooksLine3.text: Still, it's an improvement.|I miss some things here.|And a lot more I don't miss.

StoryTextNight05TBooksLine5.text: I won't keep you late.|I've got plans with D.B. and Dani anyway.

StoryTextNight05TBooksLine7.text: Something happened with them last year?|I overheard D.B. talking to Jen.|Do you know what it was?

StoryTextNight05TBooksLine8.text: Sorry, you'll have to ask them.

StoryTextNight05CavernLine1.text: See, now people are poking around|an hour after closing time.|How'd he get a key anyway?|You still won't talk about the basement?|It's hardly a secret.

StoryTextNight05CavernLine2.text: I just want to stay out of it this time.

StoryTextNight05CavernLine3.text: So people see someone walk in,|then disappear into the back room,|and you're not saying anything?

StoryTextNight05CavernLine5.text: So what if they know that..

StoryTextNight05CavernLine6.text: Hey new guy. You heard us.|Go see for yourself.

StoryTextNight05BasementMDormLine1.text: This is an old dorm for employees.|When the mall was built in 1975|they included temporary housing.|There's a kitchen & showers too.|That's Brett.

StoryTextNight05BasementMDormLine4.text: My brother found him hiding one night.|He's homeless, a run of bad luck,|so D.B. told him about this dorm.

StoryTextNight05BasementMDormLine5.text: It's just temporary, I hope.|Sorry for running away from you.|I don't want to get caught.

StoryTextNight05BasementMDormLine6.text: I understand now. Sorry.|I hope things turn around for you.

StoryTextNight05BasementMDormLine7.text: The really good stuff is this way.

StoryTextNight05BasementOfficeLine1.text: Look at these three losers.|They live down here too.|Working on their fancy mall computer.

StoryTextNight05BasementOfficeLine2.text: I told the guard to ban you.

StoryTextNight05BasementOfficeLine3.text: No need, I'm not staying long.

StoryTextNight05BasementOfficeLine5.text: State of the art computer system.|It runs the entire mall.|The climate, lights, musak..

StoryTextNight05BasementOfficeLine7.text: You don't understand any of this.|It's called the Nostalgia Engine.|We're not controlling anyone's mind.|We're giving shoppers a highly personal|and highly customized experience.

StoryTextNight05BasementOfficeLine8.text: Personal and customized?|So you're messing with their brain?

StoryTextNight05BasementOfficeLine9.text: No, no, no. You don't understand.|They remember happier times|so they stay a little longer, spend more.|It's not permanent. It wears off.|We have lawyers you know.

StoryTextNight05BasementOfficeLine10.text: This is why I only come once a year.

StoryTextNight05BasementOfficeLine11.text: Hmph. She's as miserable as ever.|I think we need to tweak the algorithm.|

StoryTextNight05BasementOfficeLine13.text: I hear you work all day every day.|That can't be good for you.

StoryTextNight05BasementOfficeLine14.text: I don't think it works on me.|I'm not unhappy, but I'm not euphoric.

StoryTextNight05BasementOfficeLine16.text: And it's only getting better.|Don't try to interfere with us.|Come back in 10-15 years,|I promise you'll be euphoric.

StoryTextNight05WWAppliancesChoice.text: Hanging around late on xmas eve?|{ Nowhere else to be  { Just leaving

StoryTextNight05WWAppliancesChoice0.text: I can totally relate to that.|My family is chaos around the holidays.|Better off being here late.

StoryTextNight05WWAppliancesLine2.text: It's nothing bad, just the usual.|Everyone gets together,|someone drinks way too much,|someone is unhappy with their gifts,|someone's kid is throws a fit.|It's the same for every family.

StoryTextNight05WWAppliancesLine3.text: Not mine, we didn't celebrate much.|One year we didn't even have a tree.

StoryTextNight05WWAppliancesLine4.text: Wow, totally opposite.|Would you want to trade?

StoryTextNight05WWAppliancesLine5.text: No, I really don't think so.|It's weird to think about.|Maybe I'd try it one year.|Not sure I'd want to every year.

StoryTextNight05CPlanetChoice.text: What should I bring tonight?|{ Need a hand?        { Good luck

StoryTextNight05CPlanetChoice0.text: I want to bring some new music to a party.|I'm already late and can't decide.

StoryTextNight05CPlanetLine2.text: No. xmas parties are for posers.|This is a party, that is on xmas eve.|It's more like a dark cabaret..| where we listen to xmas music.

StoryTextNight05CPlanetLine4.text: No. More like a punk album.|But with holiday songs.

StoryTextNight05CPlanetLine5.text: I don't think I can help this time.

StoryTextNight05CPlanetLine6.text: That's OK. It was a long shot to ask you.|Say Carl, how'd you like to tag along?

StoryTextNight05CPlanetLine7.text: I don't think I'd fit in.|Besides, I'm coming in early tomorrow.|With the mall closed I can take inventory.|That's a 12-hour job.

StoryTextDay06DemimCountryLine1.text: I can't believe it's your last day.|It came up so fast.

StoryTextDay06DemimCountryLine3.text: Yeah, you're just xmas help.|What will I do after we close?

StoryTextDay06DemimCountryLine4.text: ...|(sigh)|Have you considered the letter was wrong?

StoryTextDay06DemimCountryLine5.text: I have. We never found the sender.

StoryTextDay06DemimCountryLine6.text: (please don't send me to look again)

StoryTextDay06DemimCountryLine8.text: Jen stopped by earlier.|She said she has a parting gift for you.|Go ahead and leave early.|Thanks for everything.

StoryTextDay06NShackLine1.text: Sorry to see you leave so soon.

StoryTextDay06NShackLine3.text: I got you a little going away gift.

StoryTextDay06NShackLine4.text: Thanks.|It's a necklace...|What does the charm on it mean?

StoryTextDay06NShackLine5.text: It's just something I relate to.|It symbolizes the endless cycle of death & rebirth.

StoryTextDay06NShackLine7.text: Not at all, take this mall for example...

StoryTextDay06CavernLine1.text: I heard it's your last day.

StoryTextDay06CavernLine3.text: The mall is some people's whole life.

StoryTextDay06CavernLine4.text: The last 2 months are enough for me.|I'll work outdoors over summer break.

StoryTextDay06CavernLine5.text: I did that 2 summers ago, went badly.|I've got one year until college left.|I'll stick it out here.

StoryTextDay06CavernLine7.text: It's at least interesting.|Plus I think the machines block..|Nevermind.

StoryTextDay06CavernLine8.text: Anyway, it's just one more year.|What can possibly happen?

StoryTextDay06CavernLine10.text: If you ever come back, stop by.|Maybe we'll have something new.

StoryTextDay06SVideoLine1.text: Just saying bye on my way out.

StoryTextDay06SVideoLine3.text: I'm not working again until summer break.

StoryTextDay06SVideoLine4.text: It's so sudden, it's too bad,|you're the only person I know here.|Story of my life...

StoryTextDay06SVideoLine6.text: My family moves all the time.|I'm always the 'new girl'.

StoryTextDay06SVideoLine8.text: Sometimes, it depends on the school.|This stop is a bad one.|I just go to class & work on the weekend.|I haven't made any friends.|It's OK, we'll move again next year.

StoryTextDay06SVideoLine9.text: Sorry, I hope the next town is better.

StoryTextDay06FCBCampingLine2.text: It was nice seeing you again.|Tell your parents I said hi.

StoryTextDay06FCBCampingLine4.text: I wonder how life would be|if I decided to settle down too.|Maybe you'd be friends with my kid.

StoryTextDay06FCBCampingLine6.text: It's not for me though.|I miss my old friends a lot,|but I enjoy being unchained.|I think I'll quit this job in summer,|spend a couple months hiking & camping.

StoryTextDay06FCBCampingLine8.text: It is, and I wouldn't trade it.|That's my only advice for you,|just do what makes you happy in life.

StoryTextDay06EnterNShackChoice.text: Is there anyone else I need to see first?|{ Yeah                { Nope

StoryTextNight06EnterNShackChoice.text: Am I ready to say goodbye?|{ Yeah                { Nope

StoryTextNight06EnterNShackChoice1.text: No rush, I'll come back when I'm ready.

StoryTextNight06TBooksLine1.text: And that's really all there is.

StoryTextNight06TBooksLine2.text: Thanks for the crash course.|This isn't different than my old store.

StoryTextNight06TBooksLine3.text: They're all organized about the same.|And the registers are the same.|Learning the regulars is the most work.

StoryTextNight06TBooksLine4.text: They all seem fine so far.|I'm curious about one thing though,|if you don't mind that is..

StoryTextNight06TBooksLine6.text: I'm surprised I got this promotion.|I'd been an assistant for only 1 year.|Why did you turn down the manager job here?

StoryTextNight06TBooksLine7.text: I thought about it, a lot.|I'd rather work at the city location.|Even if I'm stuck as an assistant.|I like how busy it is, time flies there.

StoryTextNight06TBooksLine8.text: (How many years has it been anyway?)

StoryTextNight06TBooksLine9.text: Well I already like it here.|No changing your mind.

StoryTextNight06TBooksLine10.text: I won't. I've made up my mind.|If you have things under control|do you mind if I leave?|There are a few people I want to see|before it's too late at night.

StoryTextNight06TBooksLine11.text: No problem. I'll take care of closing.

StoryTextNight06BasementKitchenLine1.text: I'll try once more before I go...|how can I help you?

StoryTextNight06BasementKitchenLine2.text: I'm fine. About to leave too.

StoryTextNight06BasementKitchenLine4.text: I got a lead on some construction work.|I'm catching a late train tonight.

StoryTextNight06BasementKitchenLine6.text: Yeah, I'm staying in a trailer at first.|The pay is good so it won't be long.

StoryTextNight06BasementKitchenLine8.text: Hey, one quick thing...|I overhear those guys in the office.|I don't understand what they're up to.|But I don't think you should come back.

StoryTextNight06BasementKitchenLine9.text: It's not in my plans.|This mall is fine, but I won't be in the area soon.

StoryTextNight06WWAppliancesLine1.text: Just wanted to say goodbye.|I'm going back to my old store.

StoryTextNight06WWAppliancesLine2.text: That's a real shame, Carl.|Who will help us out at night now?

StoryTextNight06WWAppliancesLine4.text: Your store is in the city, right?

StoryTextNight06WWAppliancesLine5.text: Yeah, we're in the tower mall.

StoryTextNight06WWAppliancesLine6.text: I've never seen it, just heard about it.|Is it really 8 stories tall?

StoryTextNight06WWAppliancesLine7.text: The mall part is 8 stories.|The entire building is over 60.

StoryTextNight06WWAppliancesLine8.text: Maybe I'll pay a visit then.|It sounds like a fun trip.

StoryTextNight06WWAppliancesLine9.text: I'll keep an eye out for you.

StoryTextNight06CPlanetLine1.text: Sorry, bad news. It's my last day here.|I'm going back to my store in the city.

StoryTextNight06CPlanetLine2.text: Aw, who am I going to torment now?

StoryTextNight06CPlanetLine4.text: Seriously, you need to loosen up.|The city is no place for normal people.|How do you get by there?

StoryTextNight06CPlanetLine5.text: I work most of the time.

StoryTextNight06CPlanetLine6.text: There's your whole problem.|You're surrounded by a big city,|tons of weird interesting people,|tons of fringe stores & clubs,|and you're just working all the time.|Go try something different,|something that makes you uncomfortable.

StoryTextNight06CPlanetLine8.text: Just try once, see what happens.

StoryTextNight06VBLine1.text: It looks like you've got a new guy there.

StoryTextNight06VBLine2.text: He's my replacement, permanent manager.|I'm going back to the city location.

StoryTextNight06VBLine3.text: And I was just about to ask you if you wanted to work here instead.

StoryTextNight06VBLine5.text: I'm going to retire soon.|We already picked out a place up north.|I don't want to leave the company dry.|I want to find my replacement first.

StoryTextNight06VBLine6.text: I appreciate the consideration.|But I'd rather be in the city.

StoryTextNight06VBLine7.text: I understand. Back to square one for me.

StoryTextNight06VBLine8.text: Maybe you can convert one of the regulars.|That's how it all started for me.|I was a bookworm, now I work there.

StoryTextNight06VBLine9.text: That's a possibility.|Well best wishes.|It's been good talking to you.

StoryTextNight06VBLine10.text: Same to you. Take care.|Early congratulations on retiring.

StoryTextNight06HiddenLine00.text: I don't think we're supposed to be here.

StoryTextNight06HiddenLine01.text: Relax, no one is looking for us.|I just wanted to see if this was real.

StoryTextNight06HiddenLine02.text: I know, I remember the rumors,|from when we worked here.|That was a long time ago.

StoryTextNight06HiddenLine05.text: No, nothing like that.|This place makes me sad.|Employees living in the basement,|we probably knew some of them.

StoryTextNight06HiddenLine06.text: I'd live in a 1990 mall if could.

StoryTextNight06HiddenLine07.text: Above ground of course.|Like a fancy mall condo.

StoryTextEndBadLine3.text: Weren't you looking into a letter?|Or something like that.

StoryTextEndBadLine5.text: I think that's the best answer.|Nothing exciting like last year.

StoryTextEndBadLine6.text: That's great. I don't want a repeat.

StoryTextEndBadLine8.text: I don't want to talk about it.|Let's be glad this year was boring.

StoryTextEndGoodLine1.comment: Good and perfect ending have the same text before the credits
StoryTextEndGoodLine1.text: This is it for our group.

StoryTextEndGoodLine4.text: I have one question if it's OK...|All that stuff in the basement,|is it related to what happened last year?

StoryTextEndGoodLine7.text: I don't think I know any more.|That thing they're building..

StoryTextEndGoodLine9.text: I'm not sure what it even is.|They say it's a simulation,|but last year, that Jordan guy,|he said he was from 2014.|Either they created time travel.|Or Jordan was brain-fried.

StoryTextEndGoodLine10.text: Or maybe this is a simulation.

StoryTextEndGoodLine11.text: I considered that too.|What does that make us though?

StoryTextEndGoodLine12.text: This is getting too deep for me.|Going back to my room for the last time.

StoryTextEndGoodLine13.text: All the Iraq news will put me to sleep.

StoryTextEndGoodLine14.text: You know what's weird about it...|Those guys Cheney & Powell,|they keep getting older,|but the President though,|he looks like he's getting younger.

StoryTextEndGoodLine15.text: That's not how this part goes.

StoryTextEndGoodLine16.text: You said something different last time.

StoryTextEndGoodLine17.text: Uh-oh, I think you lost it.|Where are you right now?

StoryTextEndGoodLine18.text: You're being weird, stop it.|It's 1990 & I'm with my friends.|We met over the summer.|I helped you both every night.|Eryn joined our group in the fall.|We were together every night.

StoryTextEndGoodLine19.text: Yes, just like this right now.|Exactly how you remember.|Do you remember what happens next?

StoryTextEndGoodLine20.text: Yeah, I think I know.|We split up don't we?

StoryTextEndGoodLine21.text: I go back to my store

StoryTextEndGoodLine22.text: We're bought by a larger chain.

StoryTextEndGoodLine23.text: They can't compete though.|They start closing stores.|The smaller mall ones are first.|I'm on the liquidation team.

StoryTextEndGoodLine25.text: Didn't you used to work here?

StoryTextEndGoodLine26.text: Just for six months in 1990.|The friends I made though..

StoryTextEndGoodLine27.text: ..have all moved on with their lives.|We have two months to get this done.|Then it's off to the next town.|If you're through moping, let's go.

StoryTextEndGoodLine29.text: It's the Nostalgia Engine.|It reached its full power in 2000.|You came back here in 2002.|You wished it was 1990 again,|and that's exactly what you saw.

StoryTextEndGoodLine30.text: So it's what I heard in the basement.|It can't be true.

StoryTextEndGoodLine31.text: Did you learn anything this year?|Or this only what you remember?

StoryTextEndGoodLine33.text: What am I going to do now?

StoryTextEndGoodLine34.text: The last 12 years were a waste.

StoryTextEndGoodLine35.text: You wanted to try writing.|You told us all the time.|You're off to the next hotel room.|Forget about the news & get to work.

StoryTextEndGoodLine36.text: I don't know. Maybe it's too late.

StoryTextEndGoodLine37.text: There's only one way to know.|Beside, you already have a starting point.

StoryTextEndGoodLine38.text: A story about time travel & regrets.|It's not very original,|but some people like that kind of story.

StoryTextEndGoodLine39.text: I guess it's time to go.

StoryTextEndGoodLine40.text: When I walk out it will be 2002,|and it will stay that way.

StoryTextEndGoodLine41.text: I know you're just a memory but,|can I say goodbye anyway?

StoryTextEndPerfectLine1.comment: This is the text for the after-credits scene

StoryTextEndPerfectLine4.text: I'm happy it was a normal year.|Nothing weird happened this time.

StoryTextEndPerfectLine5.text: We're you looking into something?|A prank letter?

StoryTextEndPerfectLine6.text: That's all it was, a prank.

StoryTextEndPerfectLine10.text: I didn't want to freak you out.|Since you're leaving I'll tell you.|I can't say how I know,|but Denim Country is closing.|It's the 90s now, that style is out.|PogoDawg & this store are next.

StoryTextEndPerfectLine12.text: It's totally fine, really it is.|This wing of the mall is being replaced.|A trendy new coffee shop is going in.|I'll be running it.

StoryTextEndPerfectLine14.text: This is what you meant before?|Tearing down stores & replacing then.

StoryTextEndPerfectLine16.text: Then I'll definitely visit.|Not sure about trendy coffee,|but curious what it will all look like.

StoryTextEndPerfectLine19.text: What? Um, no, not really.|Just thinking about.. nevermind.

StoryTextEndPerfectLine21.text: I think I'll find another gig.|I bet arcades go out in the 90s.|It was nice knowing all of you.

StoryTextEndPerfectLine22.text: OK.. I guess that's a cue.|Good luck with the coffee shop.

StoryTextTradingSequenceFCBFishing1.text: Is that the scarf I lost last month?|Let me give you a finder's fee.|Please take these pocket handwarmers.

StoryTextTradingSequenceFCBFishing3.text: I insist. Be careful with them though.

StoryTextTradingSequenceFCBFishingAfter.text: Be careful with those handwarmers.|They were recalled.

StoryTextTradingSequenceFCBFirearms3.text: That's the last tape in the series.|Do you mind trading with me for it?|I can give you this moose attractant.|I already shot one.

StoryTextTradingSequenceFCBFirearms4.text: Great, thanks Randy! It's a deal.|I can't wait to find out who wants this.

StoryTextTradingSequenceFCBFirearmsAfter.text: That moose photo is one of my best shots.|I'm working on a photography book.|Can't stay in the mall forever.

StoryTextTradingSequenceWWAppliancesBefo.text: The worst thing here is parking.|They won't let us park near the door.|So we have to walk forever at night.|It's so cold out there.

StoryTextTradingSequenceWWAppliances1.text: Please take these handwarmers.|I don't want anything in return.

StoryTextTradingSequenceWWAppliances2.text: Thanks! I will use them.|I have to give you something though.|How about this lipstick?|It's brand new. It's not my color.|I don't trust the guy who gave it to me,|I think he's seeing someone else.

StoryTextTradingSequenceWWAppliancesAfte.text: Thanks again. I appreciate it.|Be smart, stay away from guys like that.

StoryTextTradingSequenceCheckersBefore.text: My new years party is coming up.|I need something to draw in the ladies.

StoryTextTradingSequenceCheckers1.text: What is that strange aroma?|Some new kind of cologne?

StoryTextTradingSequenceCheckers2.text: I suppose you could use it like that...

StoryTextTradingSequenceCheckers3.text: I'd be happy to trade for it.|All I have is this clearance shirt.|We have to get rid off all small sizes.|There's a new store policy from HQ.|We only sell to people over 6ft now.|Sorry if it's not your size.

StoryTextTradingSequenceCheckers4.text: That's fine, I'll find someone it fits.

StoryTextTradingSequenceCheckersAfter.text: No one under 6ft allowed.|It's a weird policy, I didn't make it.

StoryTextTradingSequenceCPlanetBefore.text: I could use something to freshen-up my look.

StoryTextTradingSequenceCPlanet1.text: How about this lipstick?|Please don't give me anything back.

StoryTextTradingSequenceCPlanet2.text: That is a wild color of lipstick.|Do you like underground bands?|We've giving away tickets for a show.|Take a pair with you.

StoryTextTradingSequenceCPlanet3.text: Do I have to take them?

StoryTextTradingSequenceCPlanet4.text: That's how this works.|Maybe you can find someone to go with?

StoryTextTradingSequenceCPlanetAfter.text: I can't wait for the concert next month.

StoryTextTradingSequenceWWAudioBefore.text: The dress code here is bad.|I only have one shirt that qualifies.|I'm doing laundry every day.

StoryTextTradingSequenceWWAudio1.text: It's your lucky day. I happen to have this.

StoryTextTradingSequenceWWAudio2.text: That is my size, thanks.|I'll give you this in exchange.|It's a headband radio.|I guess for running or whatever.|We just discontinued it.

StoryTextTradingSequenceWWAudio3.text: Thanks, off to find a new owner for this.

StoryTextTradingSequenceWWVideoBefore.text: This town is so boring.|I wish there was anything to do.

StoryTextTradingSequenceWWVideo1.text: Here, go to this concert.|Take both tickets, this isn't a date.|I'll be going now.

StoryTextTradingSequenceWWVideo2.text: You're giving me concert tickets?|I never heard of them but why not?|Take this portable TV demo unit.|I have to take it down anyway.|It's fun and everything,|but only gets one station in here.

StoryTextTradingSequenceWWVideo3.text: You don't understand, I do not want...Fine.

StoryTextTradingSequenceWWVideoAfter.text: I hope this band is good.

StoryTextTradingSequenceTLodgeBefore.text: There isn't a gadget we don't sell.

StoryTextTradingSequenceTLodge1.text: I don't know about that.|Do you have one of these?

StoryTextTradingSequenceTLodge2.text: Is that a headband radio?|I thought we had everything.|That is so useless & tacky.|Can I trade you for it?|I'll give you a car radio FM converter.|It's also totally useless.

StoryTextTradingSequenceTLodge3.text: It's not useless to someone I bet.

StoryTextTradingSequenceTLodgeAfter.text: Who drives a car without an FM now?

StoryTextTradingSequenceCNowBefore.text: My parents gave me an old mini-van.|It runs OK, but it's so ancient.

StoryTextTradingSequenceCNow1.text: Does it only have AM radio by chance?

StoryTextTradingSequenceCNow2.text: It does. It's so old like that.|At night I only get shows about aliens.

StoryTextTradingSequenceCNow4.text: Wow, I bet that will work in my car.|Finally, something to listen to|while I'm waiting for it to warm up.|Speaking of ancient junk from the 70s...|Take this flannel shirt.|I don't know why they keep shipping them.|They'll never be in style again.

StoryTextTradingSequenceCNowAfter.text: Thanks again! It's nice to have a radio.|Last night there was show about..|...|[30 minutes later]|and they still haven't found him.

StoryTextTradingSequenceFCBCheckoutBefor.text: Everyone is done shopping for xmas.|It's totally dead here.|I'm more bored than usual.

StoryTextTradingSequenceFCBCheckout1.text: Here's a TV you can watch.|It's slightly better than staring off.

StoryTextTradingSequenceFCBCheckout2.text: You're giving me this TV?|At least it's something to do.|Am I supposed to trade in return?

StoryTextTradingSequenceFCBCheckout4.text: Here's a coupon for angry customers.|It's good for 10% off any non-sale item,|good on weekdays in February only.

StoryTextTradingSequenceFCBCheckoutAfter.text: Is this the only station it gets?

StoryTextTradingSequenceWWCheckoutBefore.text: Hmm, how to get more after xmas shoppers?

StoryTextTradingSequenceWWCheckout1.text: What about this tacky coupon promo?

StoryTextTradingSequenceWWCheckout2.text: That coupon is a really good idea.|Can I take it to show to my manager?|I'll give you these LPs in return.|They got mixed-in with some laserdiscs.|Will anyone want LPs again though?

StoryTextTradingSequenceWWCheckoutAfter.text: Thanks again for the coupon idea.

StoryTextTradingSequenceFCBCampingBefore.text: This place takes me back to my youth.|You were too young in the 70s,|you don't know what you missed out on.

StoryTextTradingSequenceFCBCamping1.text: The clothing was alright though.|Better than the 60s & 80s.|If you don't count disco I guess.|Like this flannel shirt here.|It looks cool, but not my style.

StoryTextTradingSequenceFCBCamping2.text: You want to unload that flannel shirt?|I won't complain about taking it.|I'll give you this utility knife.|Just be careful with it.

StoryTextTradingSequenceFCBCamping3.text: Oh I will, thanks.|Maybe I'll trade it.

StoryTextTradingSequenceFCBCampingAfter.text: That knife has over a dozen uses.

StoryTextTradingSequencePogoDawgBefore.text: Have you ever... uh.|Have you ever, wait.|The thing with the movie and album.|You know, the thing?

StoryTextTradingSequencePogoDawg1.text: Are you attempting to talk about|The Wizard of Oz thing?|I don't think that's real.|Take these LPs anyway though.|Maybe one of them does something.

StoryTextTradingSequencePogoDawg2.text: I can have all these? Nice..|I'll give this, what's it called?|This, uh, thing, um, package.|The, uh, the delivery guy left it.|When the, what's it called?|When the ambulance took him.

StoryTextTradingSequencePogoDawg3.text: So your food sent him to the ER,|and you want me to finish his job?

StoryTextTradingSequencePogoDawgAfter.text: Uh... is there, yeah, uh.|Like something else you need?

StoryTextTradingSequenceVBBefore.text: Last year was so much more interesting.

StoryTextTradingSequenceVB1.text: I have this mystery box.|That could be something.

StoryTextTradingSequenceVB2.text: You don't know who that box is for?|I enjoy a mystery, let's open it.|[...]|Hmmm...|Why it's just a trophy.

StoryTextTradingSequenceVB3.text: You know what, I'll just keep this.

StoryTextTradingSequenceVBAfter.text: I wish it was something mysterious.

StoryTextTradingSequenceCavernBefore.text: Some kid jammed up a coin slot.|Looks like a random metal object.

StoryTextTradingSequenceCavern1.text: Maybe this knife has a tool for that?

StoryTextTradingSequenceCavern2.text: Yeah, that might work... let me try...|Oh, it's a big round earring.|Great, I'll toss it.

StoryTextTradingSequenceCavern3.text: I'm sure it has an owner though.|Keep the knife, you need it more than me.|I'll track down who lost that.

StoryTextTradingSequenceCavernAfter.text: I wonder who lost that earring.

StoryTextTradingSequenceDenimCountryBefo.text: (I've looked everywhere)|Sorry, I was thinking about something.

StoryTextTradingSequenceDenimCountryPC1.text: Are you looking for this maybe?

StoryTextTradingSequenceDenimCountry1.text: Yes, that's the earring I lost.|I'm so glad you found it.|I looked everywhere I could think.|This set belonged to my grandmother.|I couldn't stand to lose them.|I know this is really expensive|but I want you to have it.^

StoryTextTradingSequenceDenimCountry2.text: It came out this year & everyone wants one.|I won it from a prize machine.|I don't really need it though.|Use it, sell it. Whatever.^

StoryTextTradingSequenceDenimCountry3.text: Please take it as a thank you.

StoryTextTradingSequenceDenimCountryAfte.text: Thank you again Carl, seriously.|Those earrings mean so much to me.
